weather_report:
Subiaco wakes under a soft grey lid, the sun reduced to a pale lantern behind the cloud. The light is matte and forgiving, edges blurred, colors hushed. Forecasts suggest the overcast will hold through late morning into early afternoon, so don’t expect much in the way of blue sky; clarity remains diffused, with bright glare largely tamed. UV will be subdued but not absent—late spring can still nip around midday—so a light touch of sunscreen won’t go astray. It’s a calm, even sort of day, more companionable than thrilling.

Dress in easy layers: a breathable long sleeve or light knit, perhaps a thin jacket for comfort, and comfortable shoes for unhurried errands. With the glare gone, it’s a good morning for a quiet coffee walk, a library stop, or a measured lap through the grocer. Garden jobs feel kinder under this sky, and the soft light flatters a quick photo wander if you’re inclined. Settle by a window for focused work, then step out again when the clock drifts toward lunch; the day may not dazzle, but it invites you to move through it at a steady, human pace.
